title: Hélène

img.alt: Marie-Hélène lying on a bed drinking water

description: ongoing soft memories for a loved one lost to early. Thank you for being there. For bringing me here.

title: Parade (post-production)
description: an artistic documentary on the work of Belgian sculptor Koenraad Tinel

title: Wacht

img.alt: film still showing mathilde lying in the grass with a pink shirt.

description: Mathilde is 10 years old. She is a young rough, a drifter and a connoisseur of 90s pop ballads. She walks along a deserted road with no beginning or end. She is accompanied by Danielle, who is her spitting image. Both are waiting for tomorrow, a day their dreams might come true.

title: DOR (Longing)
description: A Romanian guy in his thirties returns to his native country and experiences a psychological crisis. He meets local sheperds and becomes immersed in the rural world that makes him question his life choices. Through his quest, the shepherds also reflect on their lives.

img.alt: filmstill of DOR showing three shepards and a flock of sheep

title: A Dark Horizon of Thought

img.alt: film still showing a piece of charcoal on a white background

description: Forest becomes object. Object gains agency and maintains a murky relationship with the human species.

title: DOUBLE (un)BOUND

img.alt: picture showing a statue in Bruges

description: DOUBLE (UN)BOUND explores the notion of repetition through the process of composition. Restricted to one instrument, one track, and one take. Each day one track will be recorded and published. The patch made on the modular synthesizer will be untied by unplugging the patch cables, at which point it can never be fully recreated again. In doing so, I want to evoke the sentiment of unresolving repetition that has become an acquaintanceship ever since the lockdown began. These studies will reflect upon the temporality of music as a composition of time or the absence thereof and the compromise to sociability. And although their fleeting nature, we will all be listening to them in the same way. In time, the intentions of this project will alter. It will grow and adapt itself to a particular motion in time. Until – finally – it will cease to exist. At which point in time silence truly does become empty.

title: Au Revoir Au Printemps

img.alt: film still of Au Revoir Au Printemps

description: Au Revoir Au Printemps is a short film that follows young Issam on his way with his father, Cherif, and Ilies, his older brother. A phone call will lead them to a hardware store, where a family argument will push them to find an answer to the question, 'what is it to be a man?'

title: P&V

img.alt: still from the commercial showing an empty crib in a child's room.

description: Advertisment for P&V Group (assurances). Campaign during covid-pandemic. Written and directed by Khaël Touag, produced by Landvogel.

title: un, deux, trois, soleil

img.alt: still from the commercial showing a youth worker in a basketball court

description: Campaign for Youth at Social Risk written and directed by Khaël Touag. Shot by Virgil Leclercq, produced by Les Mecs.

title: NEST
description: After a night out Boris, a young man in his twenties, finds his mother awake and waiting at home. While dreaming of independence, he struggles with feelings of loyalty towards his recently divorced parents. Meanwhile, he shuttles between the nightclub, the darkroom at home and his job as photographer, looking for a step forward.

img.alt: Frowst on stage at the Vooruit in Ghent (Belgium)

title: Julian

img.alt: filmstill showing Julian sitting on a ledge, drawing.

description: JULIAN is a poetic coming-of-age drama exploring the violence of being young and the hunger to find transcendence. Trapped in a big city, haunted by his contradictions and isolated from his friends, Julian is a teenager yearning for direction and substance. The vision of a secluded island slowly hijacks his daily life.
